docs.snippet: At the dedication of the new Peace Corps headquarters last week, Hillary Rodham Clinton cut a long red ribbon with two-foot-long scissors and nearly signed up.    When the Peace Corps director praised the First Lady for her character and said she...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the dedication of the new Peace Corps headquarters last week, Hillary Rodham Clinton cut a long red ribbon with two-foot-long scissors and nearly signed up. When the Peace Corps director praised the First Lady for her character and said she would be a great volunteer, Mrs. Clinton deadpanned: ''Maybe I'll just leave this afternoon. Point me in the right direction.''
docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton is playing role as First Lady during White House sex scandal with intensity that is both breathtaking and unnerving, struggling to change subject to other issues and trying to win back disillusioned voters, especially women; her popularity remains high, and loyalists say no matter what happens to President, she is lady with future; photo (M)

headline.main: Before Public, Armor Is Showing No Cracks
headline.kicker: THE TESTING OF A PRESIDENT: THE FIRST LADY

docs.snippet: AT 7:30 A.M., as the mist rises over Long Island Sound at Compo Beach in Westport, distant chirps and trills break the silence. It's a form of bird song too musical to be attributed to  sea gulls. ''They'll be here soon,'' says Angelo Veno, 70 years...
docs.lead_paragraph: AT 7:30 A.M., as the mist rises over Long Island Sound at Compo Beach in Westport, distant chirps and trills break the silence. It's a form of bird song too musical to be attributed to sea gulls. ''They'll be here soon,'' says Angelo Veno, 70 years old , and a retired developer. ''In the winter sometimes, we get 150 to 200 parrots.'' As he has every day for the past five years, Mr. Veno parks his blue Jeep across from Shilepsky Field. After distributing birdseed around a nearby flowering plum tree, he joins his friends, former firefighter Al Palumbo and former mail carrier Buck Iannacone, to wait for the morning's visitors.
docs.abstract: Pre-season auditions for musicians and singers at community orchestra and choral group in Purchase, NY, described; photos (M)

headline.main: Life at the Beach With Wild Parakeets

docs.snippet: DURING one of the first performances of Astor Piazzolla's self-described ''little opera,''  ''Maria de Buenos Aires,'' in 1968, a voice rose from the audience, repeatedly emitting profane exclamations. Backstage after the show, the culprit was...
docs.lead_paragraph: DURING one of the first performances of Astor Piazzolla's self-described ''little opera,'' ''Maria de Buenos Aires,'' in 1968, a voice rose from the audience, repeatedly emitting profane exclamations. Backstage after the show, the culprit was discovered: it was the Brazilian poet Vinicius de Moraes, paying homage in his paradoxical way to the composer's astonishing achievement. Piazzolla, after all, had managed to compose a musical theater work that, like the rest of his Nuevo Tango music, defied popular and classical categories and stood in a class of its own.
docs.abstract: Pablo Zinger article on composer Astor Piazzolla's 'little opera' Maria de Buenos Aires, which will be presented in concert version at Brooklyn Academy of Music; photos (M)

docs.snippet: RIVIERA OFF SEASON: The French Experience, a New York-based company specializing in independent travel to France, is offering a six-night package to the French Riviera for $518 a person, double occupancy, from Nov. 1 through March 31. The package...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIVIERA OFF SEASON: The French Experience, a New York-based company specializing in independent travel to France, is offering a six-night package to the French Riviera for $518 a person, double occupancy, from Nov. 1 through March 31. The package includes hotel accommodations in a deluxe room with a balcony at the Hotel Croisette Beach in Cannes; daily buffet breakfast; a minimum-category (standard shift) rental car for seven days with unlimited mileage, taxes and insurance; a half-day excursion to the Lerins Islands south of Cannes; an evening at the Casino Croisette with dinner or dinner at Le Festival restaurant on the main beachside street; a tour of the Galimard perfume factory in Grasse, and a pass providing entrance to 58 museums on the Riviera. Air fare is extra. Information or reservations: (212) 986-1115.
docs.abstract: Janet Piorko column on discounts available for trips to French Riviera, Japan, Williamsburg, Va and cruises to southern hemisphere; drawing (M)

docs.snippet: Vice President Hugo Batalla of Uruguay, for three decades a political power broker and human rights champion, died on Saturday, local news media reported. He was 72.    The cause of death was lung cancer, the reports said. The illness had forced Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Hugo Batalla of Uruguay, for three decades a political power broker and human rights champion, died on Saturday, local news media reported. He was 72. The cause of death was lung cancer, the reports said. The illness had forced Mr. Batalla, long a catalyst for political and social change, to be absent from his job for the last two months.
docs.abstract: Vice Pres Hugo Batalla of Uruguay dies at age of 72; illness had forced him to be absent from his job for last two months (S)

docs.snippet: The league's dream matchup in the championship game on Oct. 25 in the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Calif., -- the two-time defending champion D.C. United against the Los Angeles Galaxy -- is in jeopardy after Chicago's 1-0 victory over Los Angeles on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The league's dream matchup in the championship game on Oct. 25 in the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, Calif., -- the two-time defending champion D.C. United against the Los Angeles Galaxy -- is in jeopardy after Chicago's 1-0 victory over Los Angeles on Saturday in the opening game of the Western Conference finals. Los Angeles can still capture the two-of-three-game series, but Chicago, an expansion team, has played well against the Galaxy. Chicago has won three of the five games between the teams and has limited the high-scoring Galaxy to five goals. Los Angeles led the M.L.S. in scoring during the regular season with 85 goals.
docs.abstract: Soccer Notebook article focuses on Chicago's victory over Los Angeles Galaxy in first game of Major League Soccer playoff series (M)

docs.snippet: To the Editor:    The arrest of Gen. Augusto Pinochet, requested by a Spanish tribunal, has finally brought some hope of justice to the survivors of the South American genocide (front page, Oct. 18). Maybe now the international community will be...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The arrest of Gen. Augusto Pinochet, requested by a Spanish tribunal, has finally brought some hope of justice to the survivors of the South American genocide (front page, Oct. 18). Maybe now the international community will be shamed into accepting that no amnesty law can pardon a crime against humanity.
docs.abstract: Walter Palmas-Meilinger letter welcomes arrest of Gen Augusto Pinochet of Chile

docs.snippet: Catherine Mikyung Park and Dr. Wilder Dwight Fulford were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York. The Rev. Walter F. Modrys performed the ceremony.    Mrs. Fulford, 30, was until last month an account...
docs.lead_paragraph: Catherine Mikyung Park and Dr. Wilder Dwight Fulford were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York. The Rev. Walter F. Modrys performed the ceremony. Mrs. Fulford, 30, was until last month an account director at TBWA Chiat/Day, the New York advertising agency. She graduated from Wellesley College. She is a daughter of Theresa Park and Dr. Joseph Park of Indiana, Pa., where Dr. Park practices urology.

docs.snippet: Jacques Medecin, Mayor of Nice from 1966 until 1990, when he fled to Uruguay to avoid prosecution on corruption charges that later landed him in jail for nearly two years, died in Uruguay on Tuesday after several heart attacks, his family said. He...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jacques Medecin, Mayor of Nice from 1966 until 1990, when he fled to Uruguay to avoid prosecution on corruption charges that later landed him in jail for nearly two years, died in Uruguay on Tuesday after several heart attacks, his family said. He was 70. Nice, where Mr. Medecin made casinos, business leaders and the tourist industry rich but left municipal coffers nearly empty, loved him like a godfather and prepared to lay him out in state in the City Hall. The city plans to pay for funeral ceremonies, Mr. Medecin's successor, Jacques Peyrat, announced, and even Mr. Medecin's left-wing critics did not object.
docs.abstract: Jacques Medecin, Mayor of Nice, France, from 1966 until 1990, when he fled to Uruguay to avoid prosecution on corruption charges that later landed him in jail for nearly two years, dies at age 70; photo (M)

docs.snippet: As judges in Britain deliberate the fate of the one-time Chilean dictator, Gen. Augusto Pinochet, the rarefied world of international law has been sent into a flurry of activity, with lawyers issuing papers and opinions on what they see as a case...
docs.lead_paragraph: As judges in Britain deliberate the fate of the one-time Chilean dictator, Gen. Augusto Pinochet, the rarefied world of international law has been sent into a flurry of activity, with lawyers issuing papers and opinions on what they see as a case with enormous legal implications. Many scholars and jurists regard the general's unexpected arrest in London on charges of genocide and murder, and a request for his extradition by Spain, as an unusual chance to test high-minded human rights conventions that oblige countries to prosecute great atrocities but are invariably ignored. Even when Pol Pot of Cambodia was detained before his death, some experts note, no country was willing to seek his extradition and try him for his role in the deaths of at least a million Cambodians.
docs.abstract: Many scholars and jurists regard unexpected arrest in London of Chilean dictator, Gen Augusto Pinochet, and request for his extradition by Spain as unusual chance to test high-minded human rights conventions that oblige countries to prosecute great atrocities but are invariably ignored; say case will test whether Britain is willing to lets its international human rights commitments prevail over domestic law giving immunity to heads of state (M)

headline.main: Pinochet Case Spurring Debate on International Laws
